lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/Luke.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run Luke.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.
Meet Luke â€” your smart, reliable companion for staying on top of life ðŸ“…âœ¨. Whether it's saving your to-dos, tracking
deadlines, or remembering important events, Luke keeps everything organized and right at your fingertips.
You can view all added tasks with the `list` command.
The first checkbox indicates the type of task:
And the second checkbox indicates if the task has been marked
You can add todos to Luke with the `todo` command.
You can add deadlines to Luke with the `deadline` command.
`Note: <deadline> needs to be in a yyyy-mm-dd format`
You can add events to Luke with the `event` command.
You can mark or unmark tasks using the `mark` and `unmark` commands.
`Note: <index> refers to the index of the task`
marked task return book as done
You can search for tasks using keywords using the `find` command.
You can delete tasks using the `delete` command.
`Note: <index> refers to the index of the task`
* Represents a Deadline task which contains a task description and a deadline
* Represents an Event task which contains a task description, a start date and an end date
public Event(String taskDescription, String startDate, String endDate) {
* Manages all interactions with the stored data to save the ArrayList between separate sessions
* Reads storedData file on startup and populates ArrayList with saved tasks
* @param taskList the ArrayList of Task classes
* Appends a Task to the end of the storedData file
* @param append boolean to determine if Task class is appended to end of file
public static void addTask(Task task, boolean append) {
String newTask = "E||" + task.isMarked() + "||" + task.getTaskDescription() + "||" + ((Event) task).getStartDate() + "||" + ((Event) task).getEndDate();
* Rewrites storedData file with the current ArrayList of Tasks classes
* @param taskList the ArrayList of Task classes
What can I do for you?
* Parser that extracts the command from user input as well as the necessary parameters
System.out.println("Invalid deadline format, please enter in a yyyy-mm-dd format");
* Represents a Task superclass that extends to Todo, Deadline and Event
* Prints a checkbox indicating if it is checked together with its task description
* Maintains an ArrayList of Task classes.
private final ArrayList<Task> tasks = new ArrayList<>();
* Adds a Task class to the ArrayList and adds the task to the stored file.
* @param fileHandler the FileHandler class used to update the stored data
public void addTask(Task task, FileHandler fileHandler) {
* Remove Task class based on its index and removes it from the stored file.
* @param index index of Task class to be removed
* @param fileHandler the FileHandler class used to update the stored data
public void removeTask(int index, FileHandler fileHandler) {
* Creates a Task object in the ArrayList from String extracted from the stored data
* @param line a string that contains information of a Task class that was stored
System.out.println("Invalid deadline format, please enter in a yyyy-mm-dd format");
* Searches through ArrayList for task descriptions that contain a certain string
* @param string a string to search for within the task descriptions
* Marks a Task as done based on the index
* @param id index of task to be marked
* Marks a Task as undone based on the index
* @param id index of task to be unmarked
System.out.println("marked task " + tasks.get(id).getTaskDescription() + " as not done");
* Represents a Todo task which only contains a task description
event take a nap /from now /to 7 hours later
